laboratory_examinations.findings: A novel translocation was detected affecting the lncRNA, RMST, on chromosome 12. A 2 bp deletion was found on Chr12 that disrupted intron 2 of the longest transcript of RMST.
WES revealed a rare missense variant in the LEPR gene, predicted to be benign.
No CNVs were detected in the IGD cohort of 1,386 probands or in a large cohort of controls.
RMST expression in KS1-iPSCs was significantly decreased (~6%-18% vs. healthy iPSCs). During NCC differentiation on Day 11, RMST transcripts showed significant reductions (<10% of healthy NCC).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At Day 21, a 2.4-fold increase in SEMA3A and 2-fold increase in MKRN3 expression levels were evident compared to Day 11.
